thread.title: Tennis: Former champ Wawrinka knocked out of French Open in round one

title: Tennis: Former champ Wawrinka knocked out of French Open in round one
text:
May 28, 2018 / 12:53 PM / Updated 7 minutes ago Tennis: Former champ Wawrinka knocked out of French Open in round one Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
PARIS (Reuters) - Former champion Stan Wawrinka was knocked out of the French Open in the first round when he lost 6-2 3-6 4-6 7-6(5) 6-3 to Spainâ€™s Guillermo Garcia-Lopez on Monday. Tennis - French Open - Roland Garros, Paris, France - May 28, 2018 Switzerland's Stan Wawrinka during his first round match against Spain's Guillermo Garcia-Lopez REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol
The Swiss, who lifted the Musketeers Cup in 2015, led two sets to one but faded away after losing the fourth-set tiebreak.
Wawrinka, seeded 23rd in Paris, has been clawing his way back to the top after undergoing two knee surgeries last Summer. Reporting by Julien Pretot; Editing by XXXX
